Journal.Title: International journal of systematic and evolutionary microbiology

Article.ArticleTitle: Verruconis panacis sp. nov., an endophyte isolated from Panax notoginseng.

AbstractText: An endophytic strain (designated as strain SYPF 8337<sup>T</sup>) was isolated from the root of 3-year-old Panax notoginseng in Yunnan province of China. Strain SYPF 8337<sup>T</sup> grew slowly and formed pale brown to brown colonies. Phylogenetic analyses indicated that strain SYPF 8337<sup>T</sup> was placed in the Verruconis clade. Different from other Verruconis species, strain SYPF 8337<sup>T</sup> produced four-cell conidia. Furthermore, strain SYPF 8337<sup>T</sup> is the first fungus isolated as an endophyte of P. notoginseng in the genus Verruconis. Combined with the morphology and molecular analyses, a new species named Verruconis panacis sp. nov. is proposed.
